title: Fix global background music by switching from cani.mp3 to cani.mp4

requirements.text: Update the global audio implementation to load and play the provided audio file `cani.mp4` (instead of `cani.mp3`) so that music is audible when the user presses the Page 1 music start button or the global play/pause toggle.

quotes: music is not working  ,other things is fine
slient everywhere and not hearing anyhthing

acceptanceCriteria: The app requests `/assets/cani.mp4` for playback (no references to `/assets/cani.mp3` remain in the runtime audio path).
On desktop (laptop) Chrome/Edge, clicking ‚ÄúLet the roses sing for us üé∂‚Äù on Page 1 starts audible playback.
Clicking the fixed global audio toggle starts/pauses audible playback and updates its visual state accordingly.
Audio remains user-initiated only (no autoplay on initial page load or after replay).
Audio continues seamlessly across page navigation once started (no restart on page changes unless the user pauses/plays).

requirements.text: Ensure the project‚Äôs documented/declared allowed static asset list reflects `cani.mp4` as the required audio asset (replacing references to `cani.mp3`) wherever the app‚Äôs constraints or copy mention the audio filename.
acceptanceCriteria: Any user-facing or developer-facing text in the repo that specifies the required audio asset name (for this microsite) refers to `cani.mp4` (not `cani.mp3`).
No user-facing text changes introduce non-English wording.

constraints: Do not introduce audio autoplay; playback must begin only after an explicit user gesture.
Keep the existing global audio UX (persistent play/pause control available across all pages).
Do not add or depend on any external images or audio sources; use the provided `/assets/cani.mp4` file.
Do not modify files under the listed immutable frontend paths (compose instead of editing them).
Backend remains a single Motoko actor; no backend changes are required for this fix.
nonGoals: Adding additional audio tracks, playlists, or volume sliders.
Implementing third-party audio streaming, analytics, or any external media hosting.
Changing the 7-page microsite flow, page content, or visual theme beyond what is necessary to make audio work.
